meanings.definition: The first beat of a musical measure.
meanings.sent1: The conductor signaled the orchestra to start playing on the downbeat.
meanings.sent2: The band followed the downbeat of the drum to stay in rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The downbeat of the song was so clear, even the youngest musician could follow.
meanings.sent4: The downbeat of the music felt like a gentle tap on the shoulder, guiding the tempo.
meanings.sent5: The downbeat set the pace for the entire performance, leading the way for the other beats.

meanings.sent1: She had a downbeat outlook on the situation, expecting the worst.
meanings.sent2: His downbeat response to the news brought a somber mood to the room.
meanings.sent3: Despite his downbeat tone, his friends tried to cheer him up with jokes.
meanings.sent4: The downbeat comments cast a shadow over the otherwise cheerful conversation.
meanings.sent5: Her downbeat attitude was like a dark cloud hanging over the group, dampening their spirits.

meanings.sent1: The conductor's downbeat was sharp and precise, guiding the orchestra effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: With a swift downbeat, the conductor signaled the end of the piece.
meanings.sent3: The downbeat of the baton seemed to paint music in the air as it moved downward.
meanings.sent4: Each downbeat of the conductor's hand brought forth a new wave of sound from the musicians.
meanings.sent5: The downbeat of the conductor's baton was like a wand casting spells of music throughout the hall.
